Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2008 03:37PM goldendragonlady wrote: Yes, there is a lifetime limit for the Adriamycin, but not the Cytoxan, I know because I had the AC in 05, and have had a second tumor show up and will be getting Cytoxan again with Taxotere since I can't have any more Adria.  My onc even mentioned that there isn't a limit on the amount of Cytoxan a person can have. Mary

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2008 02:29AM goldendragonlady wrote: Hi ladies, This is my second round with bc, and my second time with chemo.  Last time(05) it was mid spring so not too cold, but my sleep cap kept coming off at night, not a big problem as I was having hot flashes at the time and it was a lot easier to cool off.  This time I believe I have been finally pushed into menopause as I haven't had any hot flashes or periods since April.  Had my first TC tx yesterday and want a nightcap which won't fall off.  What type of hat do you wear at night?

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 08:37PM goldendragonlady wrote: Okay Allie, my surgeon checked my breast and noticed that it is sightly swollen and a little pink.  She said that it could be caused by an infection OR that it is caused by lymphadema in the breast.  She put me on some antibiotics.  I am to give the antibiotics a week, if no improvement she will set me up with a physical therapist to give me some massage tricks to help resolve the lymphadema.  She said that the lymphadema usually resolves in about 6 months.  I hope the antibiotics do the trick.  It would be annoying to have a sore boob for 6 months!!!!! Mary

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2008 08:22PM goldendragonlady wrote: Hi Allie et all, I have an addendum, the steristrips on my lumpectomy incision had not even gotten loose when I went in to see my surgeon, and they didn't want to come off easily for her in the office, so she said to work them off in the shower.  So I did, well when I got out of the shower I looked down and noticed that my incision had a 1/4 opening in it where it hadn't(is hadn't a word?)closed yet. So hopefully it IS an infection and will heal up now that I am on antibiotics. M
